body_html:
Have you edited your tensorflow/WORKSPACE file for android to make sure that the paths are correct for your NDK/SDK installs?

The direct reason for failure is that it's running /bin/false. This typically happens when bazel can't find a necessary binary, such as one of the Android build tools. This unfortunately leads to some pretty unintuitive error messages.

The direct reason for failure is that it's running /bin/false. This typically happens when bazel can't find a necessary binary, such as one of the Android build tools. This unfortunately leads to some pretty unintuitive error messages.
body:
Have you edited your tensorflow/WORKSPACE file for android to make sure that the paths are correct for your NDK/SDK installs?

The direct reason for failure is that it's running /bin/false. This typically happens when bazel can't find a necessary binary, such as one of the Android build tools. This unfortunately leads to some pretty unintuitive error messages.
